intro: Nematostigma paniculatum, commonly known as the grape hyacinth, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has strap-like, grassy leaves. Its bulbs are used in ornamental gardening for their vibrant purple or blue flowers. Nematostigma paniculatum is relatively low-maintenance and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun.
